website_summaries.verdict: These sturdy RV steps with a handrail are perfect for travelers who need a bit more stability.
pros: Handrail makes getting in and out of an RV extra safe
Height of 21 inches is great for taller RVs
cons: Some said it requires two people to assemble

customer_reviews.title: Stairs are great. This is not a negative review.
customer_reviews.text: Stairs are great. Sturdy, not too heavy. Dropping one star due to [insert reason that Amazon will not let me express here]. Showed up without [insert missing items here], but was easy to put together anyway after picking up [missing parts] from Home Depot. [insert positive remark about Amazon customer service that Amazon apparently doesn't think is pertinent here] - simply easier this way and I got to use the stairs that night. Note to Amazon: this now specifically addresses my experience with the item. I have deleted the references to the things you think are not necessary for someone who is contemplating a purchase to know. Now can it post?
customer_reviews.author: Glen L Jones

customer_reviews.title: good well built product
customer_reviews.text: this is a very sturdy set of stairs. A couple words of advice though 1. it does take two people to put it together easily. One person can do it but there are certain moments when it needs two sets of hands; one to hold it place and another to put the screws in. 2. when the directions say put the screws in when the stairs are upside then leave it upside down. I snapped the treads into place and I thought I could turn it right side up before attaching the braces. that doesn't work because then the holes on the braces won't line up with the holes on the treads.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: I hate to return for this
customer_reviews.text: Rivet Broken. Makes it a problem to fix. I sawed the rivet in two, but the rivet is very tight in the hole. I hate to return for this, but I would not buy another one--- of these -lets see if the company wants to make some adjust ment. I will follow up if something gets done.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to use for steps for our travel trailer instead of using the trailer steps. We were parked for 4 months in Arizona so didn't want the trailer to move so much every time we stepped on the steps. We really needed the 3 step one instead of the 2 step because our trailer sits a little higher but we built these up with some cement blocks and they worked just fine. They are made nice and fold down nice. Just measure and make sure you order the right size. These were only 21" high and we could have used the 28".
customer_reviews.author: RMalzahn

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly. Solid steps
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Solid steps. I used some aftermarket knobs to allow easy disassembly to move it for travel. We are using it for our class A RV due to wife's bad knees and the need for short rise steps. 7" is good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful solution for entry / exit in RV
customer_reviews.text: We thought this would be lightweight and not solid. Although it is light, the bracing makes it very sturdy. We use it for our RV. It makes entry and exiting the RV, especially with your hands full, much easier. Easier on our dogs too. We did note one bolt hole was a little off, but fixed it with a round file. We did use our own bolts since this did not come with lock washers - just carriage bolts. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for me.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in good codition. They are a perfect fit for my older fifth wheel.They also provide a more stable platform w/o a shorter rise for each step. I waited a while to write this review, but I find them to be the ideal step for my trailer and situation.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Richey

customer_reviews.title: Great stairs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to improve access to our new garage. We are planning to put an endless pool in our third garage so we needed a place to put our lawn tractor and golf cart. We live on a mountain in the country. The stairs worked great but do require some assembly. Not bad but hard for a one armed man working by himself. Stairs are heavy and well built. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Heulitt, MD

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy steps
customer_reviews.text: The stairs are solid and well made. Setup would not be bad under normal circumstances. On the set I received the finish was badly scraped up and seems like the paint will wear off / scratch easily. My set was missing the hardware and had damage, but I believe it was due to rough treatment during shipment. I deducted a star for paint durability. I would still recommend this product for anyone who finds stepping up normal RV steps to be challenging.
customer_reviews.author: coastsearcher

customer_reviews.title: Works well but heavy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this so my wife who is physically handicapped can get in and out of our travel trailer. These steps are nicely built and rugged and fit well in front of the doorway of our trailer. They can be a little clumsy to assemble and disassemble but do fold down to a flat shape that rides well in the bed of our truck. Big problem is that they are heavy so we don't always use them if we are just stopping for one night.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Rund (rund@tctc.com)

customer_reviews.title: They fold up for easy storage
customer_reviews.text: The steps are good and sturdy. The reason for 3 stars because they need improvement in places. One of which is where at one end of the braces they are rivoted on they could be bolted. The holes where you bolt the braces on you have to tweek the steps in order to put the bolts through if they had a slightly larger hole it wouldn't take along time to set up. Over all I would recommend them if you are low on space.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Finally! Wide Trailer Steps That Are Easy to Navigate
customer_reviews.text: I like the durability of these steps! It was shipped out to me right away and I appreciate that. The assembly didn't go as easily as the diagram made it seem. The screw holes didn't quite line up but with a little elbow grease I was able to get the bolts and nuts tightened. Could not assemble the railing as the holes didn't line up either but I can drill new holes. I am happy with my purchase as I wanted wide steps that are easy to navigate and these steps are all that.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Barrak

customer_reviews.title: Nice Solid set of steps bad packaging!
customer_reviews.text: Nice Solid set of steps Arrived damaged, did not want to wait for a new set or hassle with repacking this. So used drilled out the broken rivet, straitened with channel locks and used one of the spare bolts. This left the coating damaged so will need to repaint the damaged area.
customer_reviews.author: DylisTN

customer_reviews.title: Steps for hot tub.
customer_reviews.text: These steps were purchased for a hot tub. I needed the extra step because the hot tub was built on a platform. It was very east to assemble but the package arrived damaged and the is slight visible damage to one of the steps. Not enough to send back but I was very concerned with the packaging which had visibly been mishandled and damaged. Some of the screw holes don't line up perfectly but with a little extra effort they got through.
customer_reviews.author: P. Upton

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: We’d only had the steps for a month when two of the rivets broke making it unusable and dangerous. We were collapsing the steps down when they both snapped. We’d only used them 3 times! It was very disappointing for the price. Although we could still return it we would have to pay for the shipping which would be costly and defeat the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: TangledUpInKnots

customer_reviews.title: Serves It’s Intended Purpose
customer_reviews.text: This product came in a box that was damaged. Most of the hardware was missing. However, Amazon did issue a partial credit because it was too bulky and heavy for me to try to return. Once I found the right hardware, I was able to assemble it. The railing is a little wobbly and if it is not placed on flat and solid surface can be tippy unless bolted to something.
customer_reviews.author: ostbye

customer_reviews.title: decent step
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble sturdy steps. few bolts and you can fold back flat. in box or out flatten back down to travel. you need three foot by four foot,by couple inches thick. storage space. fits in my back bay storage of daybreak. could maybe carry in toad or a mount on ladder. a lot easier to use than step on motor home . handrail great too. weighs about 45 lbs
customer_reviews.author: uniman

customer_reviews.title: I need to talk to the seller
customer_reviews.text: The boxed arrived sooooo damaged & opened. The stairs are nice but very damaged. I will willing to keep them for my RV if I can get into touch with the seller to give me missing bolts and braces. The stairs themselves are very nice. I love the no slip grip on the stair surface. They seem easy enough to put together, but because they are so damaged I can't use them yet. Hoping to get missing parts without a trip to Lowes or Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Morris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are building a home and needed a place to live during the building so we bought a rv. I'm handicapped and don't manage stairs well and struggled with the ones on the rv. These make things so much easier. They are very sturdy, and have a much easier climb ratio. Easy to assemble as well.
customer_reviews.author: Susi G

customer_reviews.title: Great steps for exercise
customer_reviews.text: I love these stairs great for what I bought them for, exercise. I don't have stairs in or outside my home so I bought these for exercise. I would recommend these to anyone for exercise in the home or to use to get in your home or for whatever your heart desires.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Demers

customer_reviews.title: Very stable.  We don't use the pull out steps on our RV anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, very sturdy. The fold out steps attached to our RV are very shaky. I was going to replace them with fold inside the camper (VERY EXPENSIVE). We have a perm site in South Georgia, bought two sets of steps for each door on our camper for less than ONE of the fold type.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Steps for Fifth Wheel
customer_reviews.text: I am sure the product is probably wonderful, we did not open the box or try to install we have returned them because of changing circumstances and did not need them after all! They are designed to not be portable and to be stationary. We needed something that could be portable!
customer_reviews.author: Gardenqueen4life

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier to bear....
customer_reviews.text: I am using in a class c motorhome. I have bad hips and knees. I have been having to crabwalk up the original stairs. I have been able to walk up the stairs with the shorter steps with ease. very good quality and secure. I would not want to live without these and I just set them up yesterday. I give this a 5 star rating all day long!!!
customer_reviews.author: David  Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This step is heavy enough to stay in place and support weight. My son is 250 lb and it handled the weight fine. Stair surface is non stick and the attached railing makes the stairs easier to climb. We're using it for a hot tub and am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ritchie B

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, easy to transport.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 23' trailer. My 87yr old mother-in-law has difficulty going up steps and this is perfect. Also, great when carrying items into the trailer. We can fold it up when we are traveling and put it inside the trailer or the back of the pick-up. It isn't light weight, but can be moved fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: JReadie

customer_reviews.title: Super simple to set up and very sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: These stairs are fantastic!! We use these with our class C RV. I am disabled due to a brain injury and have balance issues. The built in step on our RV was very difficult for me to use, so we got these. We just take out 6 screws for the bracing brackets and they fold down flat. When it's time to set them up again, they are very simple and VERY sturdy. We've had many other campers stop and ask where we got them. I LOVE these stairs!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Gosselin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight, durable unit
customer_reviews.text: I think I said it all in the title. We needed steps up to a riser being used as a sound stage for a festival. It worked even better than we imagined. The railing and no-skid surface on the steps themselves were an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: JFY

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Was refinancing my house and needed a quick stair solution for my back door. Works great. The only complaint I have is that for some reason the hardware was missing...almost like it fell out of the box in transit. Standard screws and nuts worked though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You may have to drill some new holes.
customer_reviews.text: I like these steps, however getting the brace holes to line up is a straight b#tch. On the bottom steps, one side was easy, the one opposite was a nightmare, had to beat it with a rubber hammer to line it up. Same thing with the middle step, one side easy, one side hard. The braces behind the top step, not a chance unless I can get someone to drill two new holes. I would like to give them a five star, because they look nice, and would be sturdy if not for that. If you're a handyman, you will do well with these.
customer_reviews.author: Posey

customer_reviews.title: We Are Thrilled!
customer_reviews.text: We are as excited as we can be over a set of steps. These arrived 4 days sooner than expected and were incredibly easy to assemble. Just push out the steps, secure the attached braces with screws and add the rail. They are surprisingly sturdy on their own, but we will probably attached them to the trailer. We like that the top landing is a bit larger than the two steps, but those are ample, too.
customer_reviews.author: C Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Bomb-diggity!
customer_reviews.text: These are heavy, but not unmanageable. I'm an out of shape senior woman and I fold this up and attach it to the exterior of my travel trailer. Takes a few minutes to unfold and place the bolts. The envy of my RV friends. I have a porch!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: didn't realize weight 60 lbs - HELP
customer_reviews.text: Anyone have any ideas of how I can easily get these steps in and out of the back of my van/RV? I'm 66 yrs old and I didn't think these steps were this heavy and I certainly don't want to have to disassemble them each time I use them. Any input would be really appreciated. I'm not sure if I'll be able to use the handrail to raise or lower the unit because of the weight
customer_reviews.author: M. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: Was not shipped on date indicated or guaranteed. Had to cancel original order, reorder to get delivered where I had relocated my trailer 900+ miles away. Arrived, shipping packaging was in shambles, steps were scratched up pretty, but no time to replace. 2 dings on a 5 star rating = 3 stars. But, they are performing well.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Some scratches and dents but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Received this and started putting together. When pulled out of the box you can tell this product was used already. Bent and scratched in multiple places. The screws, nuts and bolts were randomly all over the box and missing some of them as well. I would send it back but it seems like a pain to unassemble, send back and reassemble a new one. I’d like some of my money back considering this was a used stair set. Just frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Jill K

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased and just as advertised. I use mine outside to get to a taller place in the back yard. My dog also uses it as well. I also like the versatility of the railing and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: K Nielson

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction. Great price!
customer_reviews.text: We are getting ready to redo our front porch and steps. But we still needed temporary steps to be able to get to the door. This was a perfect solution! Seems to be very sturdy. It was able to hold my father and I at the same time. That was well over 300 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Albright

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, used for travel trailer step for handicapped
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Use it as replacement entry step into travel trailer, for handicapped individual. Step height of 7 inches is perfect, with well sized steps and larger top step to use as platform. Sturdy railing, can be placed on either side. Like the non slip step coverings. Very easy assembly. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: No fear of falling
customer_reviews.text: I can't even begin to explain what I pleasant surprise it is. Very sturdy, perfect height hand rail, non skid steps and the EXACT height of my door. Somewhat like Mary Poppins. Practically perfect in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E. Geary

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy stairs
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. No longer am I afraid of navigating the built in steps of the travel trailer during the day or at night. Even the dog seems more confident climbing up and down! However, it is heavy but well built, kind of pain to assemble/reassemble, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mabe0840

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and easy to setup. Happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when the motor went out of my motorhome steps. They worked so well that my daughter said they will always use these steps going forward and not the motorized steps.
customer_reviews.author: James D Watson

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This staircase and handrail work perfectly with my hot tub. My husband is getting older and the extra safety of the handrail has been great!
customer_reviews.author: P. Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing quality issue
customer_reviews.text: This product is very sturdy and seems like it would be super easy to set up. However the steps won’t unfold. They appear to be slightly torqued and as much as I tried with a pry bar I couldn’t get the one side to unfold. The box is not damaged in the least. I think this might be a quality control issue. For what they cost, right now I am extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice stairs.
customer_reviews.text: The stairs were a good price. They're not made to abuse but to get from point A up to point B. They're perfect for my use and able to fit in my honey coach for storage.
customer_reviews.author: ChowOwner

customer_reviews.title: This staircase system has many applications!
customer_reviews.text: I hooked two together and made an excellent solution for a back door staircase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C.

customer_reviews.title: Not tall enough for 5th wheel
customer_reviews.text: Much shorter than i expected 2 feet shorter than other steps, not tall enough to get inside 5th wheel. Didn't have any hardware or instructions. I haven't been able to find information to contact sender.
customer_reviews.author: staci

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Handle has sharp spots where the metal is cracked. Not worth the effort to return it but I expected better quality for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Product would work great for what we need--the bolts that holds the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: Product would work great for what we need--the bolts that holds the bottom steps were broke and we had to use blocks to support it. The packaging was not damaged when we received it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Scheuermann

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought step ladder for my mobile boutique. I love the handle bar, so customers feel more secure coming up & going down. Mostly, I like that its sturdy & slip resistant. The ONLY reason I have it 4 stars is because it's too heavy for me to move by myself. So I always have to ask for help from someone me get it out. My husband is planning on adding wheels to the back so I can lean it back & push it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the product we were looking for. It was extremely easy to assemble. Sturdy for outdoor use!
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: Love our steps
customer_reviews.text: These are being used on our class a Bounder Rv. They make getting in and out so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Waterhouse

customer_reviews.title: Balance is important.
customer_reviews.text: We use this to get in and out of our spa! It’s perfect and has a handle to protect and assist family members to get in and out of the spa.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice steps
customer_reviews.text: Very strong,will hold heavy weight. Just wish the rail was a little heavier.
customer_reviews.author: grammie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product, well priced. Using to get on and off fishing dock
customer_reviews.author: Wanetadrift

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!  Handrail has no way of being attached!
customer_reviews.text: The handrail cannot be attached to the staircase. This is very upsetting since this is our only access to our home! There are no holes drilled in the handrail to attach it to the staircase!
customer_reviews.author: Ann V. Peluso

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very poor construction broke under use after less than a week.
customer_reviews.author: CBT

customer_reviews.title: Extremely safe now
customer_reviews.text: We assembled the stair and use it to enter our above ground spa. I have a bad knee but feel very secure now with our stair and the attached handrail.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Patterson-Barton

customer_reviews.title: No bolts!!!
customer_reviews.text: Missing pieces,no bolts in box.box was ripped on side.no protective packaging.steps are very nice but too expensive to have to go to hardware store and buy bolts before using. Needed to add comments. Since bolts were not included we thought we could get something that could be removed easily so we could fold up steps. Can’t do that! Steps are heavy and the metal is sharp. Not going to be easily moved.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to put by my camper. It's not as steep as the steps that are on my camper. Didn't take too long to put together. Seems pretty sturdy and has the anti skid stuff on steps and top to prevent falls.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L. Kanger

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much already assembled - just have to pull the legs up into place and secure with a couple bits and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Laure Haddock

customer_reviews.title: excellent product. Love it just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: excellent product. Love it just what I wanted. Nice steeps.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Use for Entry to Hot Tub
customer_reviews.text: I needed taller hot tub entrance steps with a handrail. This is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: John Latta

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Heavy duty. Not portable.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty. Sturdy. Very heavy. Great if your RV is parked, but if you are on the move, these are super heavy, bulky, and large. Still a great product...just not portable.
customer_reviews.author: AppKate

customer_reviews.title: They're made better than the travel trailer
customer_reviews.text: Precisely what I needed! Now I won't worry about my mother tumbling out the door! Using them on a Jay Flight SLX 154BH Baja Ed. They're made better than the travel trailer!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Boerner

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Dislike the handle being so far up. Unable to close door unless move the steps
customer_reviews.author: Doryce

customer_reviews.title: arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Arrived without the hardware. No way to contact the manufacturer to get the hardware
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mann

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Very strong. Used as stairs for an elderly lady to bed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C

customer_reviews.title: Finally I can use my spa without using a ladder
customer_reviews.text: I like the height and the ease to be able to get in our spa
customer_reviews.author: Terry Rademacher

customer_reviews.title: Great price for some steps for an RV/Tiny House!
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy, fold out, put in screws, Tada! it's held up to about 4 months so far of us going in and out of the Tiny House it's being used on. Fantastic bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Breezer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love these stairs. They are so sturdy and is exactly what I was looking for. There is very little installation and I was impressed with the manufacturing of the entire product.
customer_reviews.author: CharSprog

customer_reviews.title: Great Steps!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use on my Dad's Park Model trailer. They are nice and sturdy and the steps have great traction which was crucial for my Dad. Box arrived a big banged up but the stairs were not damaged in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne James

customer_reviews.title: The steps are sturdy with a slip resistant finish and a sturdy handrail.
customer_reviews.text: We use this product for hot tub steps. I like the fact that it's sturdy and has a hand rail so that anyone young or old can use it. I would recommend these steps and would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Newton

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough to assemble but bolts included were inadequate
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to assemble but bolts included were inadequate. They "wrung into" very easily as they were tightened by this 66 year old woman. The handrail is nice looking but is not sturdy for anyone to lean on.
customer_reviews.author: sidonne west

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The product is perfect I use them for outside of my mobile home
customer_reviews.author: marci

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy, just right for our 18ft travel trailer. the three little dogs love it too.
customer_reviews.author: M. GEMMELL

customer_reviews.title: Steps
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product. Whent to get her easily and quickly.
customer_reviews.author: suzan gunderson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the stairs for my Mom, she is 80 years old and disabled and uses a cane. She loves the stairs and feels more stable when going in and out of her RV. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Deena Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Love it, great for those whose knees have trouble ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it, great for those whose knees have trouble with the standard stairs that are on the trailer. Was very easy to assemble and is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Dedie

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and durable. The non-slip tops are great. We didn't install the hand rail, so can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Gray52

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was having construction done on my house and this worked great to get in and out of the house
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and feel very secure on them. Worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Fawn Dietz

customer_reviews.title: No more creaky knees!
customer_reviews.text: No more creaky knees! My 89 year old, blind mother travels with us - and this does the trick! A side benefit is - our knees no longer snap and crack either! Sturdy and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Cora

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well built.
customer_reviews.text: It is as descibed. Very sturdy and well built. Somewhat costly but there are no comparable alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Shane L.

customer_reviews.title: If you need a set of steps buy these nice steps
customer_reviews.text: very well made nice steps bought them for my mothers place. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Sturdy, easily assembled.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to assist me with entrance into my RV. Easy to assemble. Sturdy and safe feeling. Great value. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Moneysaver

customer_reviews.title: Smart product
customer_reviews.text: Work as expected. Railing was wobbly, had to rebolt to stabilize.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Great steps
customer_reviews.text: Great steps, really aided the entry to and exit from our motor home. Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: ron henry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the 1985 RV
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and sturdy. Lined up nice at the door
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: In our 70's something we really need at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Bonds

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect to get in and out of my hot tub.
customer_reviews.author: Judi Womac

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit once assembled. Good value for price. We use it to acces a portable stage
customer_reviews.author: Hugh L. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Great Steps
customer_reviews.text: These steps are real sturdy and don't take up much room. Just what we needed. :o) p.s. Shipping was great, too!
customer_reviews.author: carockie

customer_reviews.title: Great Sturdy Steps!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together very sturdy perfect for our RV Much better than just the normal pull down steps attached to the RV
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Williams

customer_reviews.title: Missing hardware (to attach handrail and secure brace) and instructions
customer_reviews.text: Would like instructions and hardware shipped to me, so I don't have to return the heavy item
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. I'm happy with these stairs. They are heavy duty and sturdy. Easy to put together. The perfect height for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: KATIE RUSSELL

customer_reviews.title: Back up rehab tool for isolation
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product to have for our patients in COVID quarantine
customer_reviews.author: Jane Ketterman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The steps are slip resistant, good quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Garza

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing delivery
customer_reviews.text: Box was torn and open in my driveway. All hardware was missing. I had to purchase nuts and bolts from Wal-Mart in order to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Ard

customer_reviews.title: it's sturdy and yet movable
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it as a step into my shop off my pool deck. it's sturdy and yet movable.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Bolt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel trailer
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and great steps for a camper. Really love them
customer_reviews.author: candy ricouard

customer_reviews.title: Love these stairs/steps
customer_reviews.text: These stairs work really well for an rv. They are also versatile enough to be folded up when moving. I like these better than the original stairs/steps that came with the trailer!
customer_reviews.author: kjoetoots

product_meta.title: Stromberg Carlson EHS-102-R Second Step for Fifth Wheel
product_meta.description: Our Econo Porch provides the stability of the ground it rests on. The rise is comfortable for grandma as well as the grandkids. This step comes fully assembled, simply unfold the step and attach 6 lock open braces for stability. 300 lb. weight capacity. Interchangeable handrail for left or right hand usage
feature_bullets: 7 Inch rise, total platform height of 21 Inch
Interchangeable handrail for left or right hand usage
